description: DMS generated id for each pass
UNIX timestamp
Direction the train(s) are travelling into the system. Please refer to external documentation for meaning of Incoming and Outgoing for a site.
Entity id for the site (11-char DMS id)
Site client id
Entity id for the train
Train client id
Class of a vehicle/train
Orientation of the train relative to consist base (Forwards/Backwards/Unknown)
Entity id for the vehicle
Vehicle client id
Index/position of vehicle within the train
Entity id for the component
Index of the component (ComponentIndex)
DMS valid short string format for component category
Component client id
DMS valid short string format for component position
Entity id for the subsystem
Subsystem client id
Subsystem type string
Entity location of the vehicle side
System side (where measurement was taken)
Index of processing generator for this measurement
Gets or Sets MeasurementTimestamp (OpenAPI uses string ISO or similar); this CSV stores Unix seconds when available
Work package stream name
Feature id
Feature template id
DMS valid short string format
Name of the parameter for this measurement.
Gets or Sets Value
Status of the measurement. If 0 it is "OK", if 1 it is "Not Measured", if 12 it is "Component Missing".
A human readable field for the status field.
A rating from 0 - 4 on processor confidence in the measurement. If 5, then confidence is undefined.
A human readable field for the confidence field.
Gets or Sets RawValues (array of raw parameter values)
Classification of result based on parameter settings at time of result import (NotMeasured, Ok, Alarm, Monitor, PartlyMeasured, Invalid, ComponentMissing)
The threshold exceeded by the measurement value
DMS valid short string format (comparison operator)
